title: Flaco the owl from Central Park
content:
Flaco the owl from Central Park

Flaco is a male Eurasian eagle-owl. Initially he was in Central Park Zoo in New York City but escaped and has been taking up residence in Central Park since then. Flaco`s escape attracted a lot of attention. People were concerned if he could live in wild nature and feed himself. But Flaco showed that he was able to. Flaco became a celebrity for New Yorkers. They signed a petition to let him stay free in Central Park.

The Eurasian eagle-owls (Bubo bubo) usually resides in Eurasia and do not inhabit North America but there are few in zoos. It is a large owl which can weigh about 3 kg and the wingspan can reach 190 cm. Like most other owls, it is nocturnal. The bird has distinctive ear tufts and orange eyes. They are predators eating rats, rabbits, pigeons and even large insects. In wild nature they prefer to live in mountain areas where they can also build anest and raise their chicks. In the wild they can leave for up to 20 years. There were cases when these species lived around 60 years in a zoo. Healthy adults normally have nonatural predators, thus these owls are considered as apex predators.

Flaco was taken to the Central Park zoo when he was about one year old and spent 12 years in captivity. His cage was a bus size with fake mountains and painted background.

In February 2023 Flaco's enclosure was vandalized. Someone made a hole in the fence and Flaco escaped. After several weeks from his escape he was seen catching and eating his prey. Park officials tried to recapture Flaco with traps but he escaped them too.

Zoo staff had concerns that Flaco would be able to fly and catch food for himself. But he successfully improved his flight and hunting skills. Later the staff made several attempts to capture him but Flaco proved he can learn and live in the wild, so they decided to let him stay free and monitor him ready to help if necessary.

Flaco has faced many dangers including rat poison, traffic and window collision. Also he met a huge amount of Central Park inhabitants like squirrels and blue jays.

Officials and bird watchers criticized people for sharing the location of Flaco in social media as it leads to huge crowds of people following the bird. Also some people start to make noises and come too close to the bird. All these actions are against ethical guidelines for birdwatching. Flaco cannot have a good rest and time to recover after hunting.

Flaco's story inspired people showing that even after years of a dull life you can start a new one learning skills and discovering a new environment for yourself.
